page.title: 03CHARLTON MARSHALL - (1)
page.content: The village of Charlton Marshall has changed considerably over the last twenty-five years. Instead of mainly rural countryside on the southern side of the A35O, it has become a built up area between the main road and the railway line (now disused). The housing estates built in the last twenty-five years are Meadow Road/Maygrove; Greenfield Road; Charlton Mead; Charlton Manor; Cerelton Park and Charlton Beeches. Charlton Manor estate was built on the site of the old manor house which belonged to the Castleman-Smith family,and Cerelton Park was built in the grounds of a private school - Clayesmore. The original school was to be left standing but unfortunately burnt down before conversion took place.. .
